column4: I have a big problem. I can't use sudo at all! "sudo: timestamp too far in the future: May 24 20:25:39 2007" What can I do?
I got the problem after MythTV installed a timeserver.
try killing your timestamp with sudo -K
Doesn't work.
your time correct?
Om the clock yes. And it worked just before install MythTV.
you did "sudo -K" and then "sudo <whatever>"?
I tried, but I get the same error.
hmm...try lower-case k and see if that works
also, can you log in separately as root?
Samething.
I locked root. It doesn't have a password.
unfortunate
rebooting should clear it, though one would of course prefer not too
I don't want to reboot either and the daemon is installed so I'm not sure it helps.
well, you can wait for the time to expire :)
how far off is the clock?
Two hours.
The clock in the BIOS was wrong so I changed it. That migth have something to do with it, but as I could install Mythtv, I guess it's not the reason.
well, the problem is the file /var/run/sudo/<username>, if you can get rid of that...
ompaul I have a look at it right away.
